info.title: Premier API
info.description: Enhance your apps, records, or experience with robust nonprofit profile financials, people, DEI, and IRS compliance validation.

get.description: Use an EIN in the path parameter to retrieve data on a nonprofit's financials, people, DEI, and IRS compliance validation. This endpoint is deprecated; use /premier/v3 instead.
Use an EIN in the path parameter to retrieve a PDF of a nonprofit's financials, people, DEI, and IRS compliance validation.

schema.description: PDF containing information for the organization with the given ein

get.description: Use an EIN in the path parameter to get a PDF of a nonprofit's financial trends analysis.

schema.description: PDF containing financial analysis trend for the organization with the given ein

get.description: Use an EIN in the path parameter to retrieve data on a nonprofit's financials, people, DEI, and IRS compliance validation. This endpoint is deprecated; use /premier/v3 instead.
Use an EIN in the path parameter to retrieve data on a nonprofit's financials, people, DEI, and IRS compliance validation.

Programs2.description: Collection of an organizations programs and program metrics

Program2.description: Information about an organization's program as entered by the organization

description.example:
Through data, research, and our collective experience, Candid provides our users with the knowledge they need to make strategic decisions and develop practical solutions to achieve their missions. 

Our GuideStar searchable database currently includes data on 1.9 million 501c3 entities, making it easier to understand who they are and what they do. We support ongoing learning and research by gathering, indexing, and sharing the sectors collective knowledge on IssueLab while also producing our own research that shares insights on issues affecting the social sector. We provide data and knowledge to the philanthropic field by creating new issue-based web portals known as Foundation Landscapes on the topics that matter most to the sector. Through Glasspockets we provide the data, resources, examples, and action steps foundations need to understand the value of transparency, be more open in their own communications, and help shed more light on how private organizations are serving the public good. Candid works closely with organizations around the globe to assist them in collecting and organizing their regions philanthropy data by sharing what we have learned over the past 60 years about data acquisition and data architecture. 

Candids CF Insights program is the leader in data collection and research for the community foundation field in the U.S. with a reputation for benchmarking and analysis of trends. Through CF Insights, we continue to deliver a high level of service to our members and worked with partners to release groundbreaking research on the need for increased collaboration amongst leaders of community foundations.

We also have a number of blogs across our platforms (including the GuideStar blog, GrantSpace blog, GrantCraft blog, GlassPockets blog, Philanthropy News Digest Blog, and more!) that shine a light on relevant topics and trends affecting the sector.

Programs3.description: Collection of an organizations programs and program metrics

leader_profile.example:
Bradford K. Smith leads Candid as its President. Mr. Smith joined Candid (formerly Foundation Center) as President in October 2008.

Previously, he was president of the Oak Foundation in Geneva, Switzerland. Prior to that, he developed and led Ford Foundation's Peace and Social Justice Program. During his 10-year tenure as vice president, he distributed hundreds of millions of dollars to organizations working on human rights, international cooperation, governance, and civil society in the U.S. and around the world.

Mr. Smith has devoted his entire career to the philanthropic and nonprofit sectors. He serves on the board of directors of the Tinker Foundation and the advisory board of the United Nations Trust Fund for Human Security. He holds an M.A. in economics from the New School for Social Research in New York and a B.A. in anthropology and ethnomusicology from the University of Michigan.

organization_id.description: A unique number identifying organizations and organizational entities.

organization_info_last_modified.description: Date the organizations information was last updated.

organization_name.description: The public name recognized by the IRS.

organization_name_aka.example: The Foundation Center,  Foundation Center, GuideStar, GuideStar USA

state_name.description: State (Full Name) of the organization's address.

zip.description: Zip code of the organization's address.

filing_req_code.description: This indicates the primary return(s) the organization is required to file.

charity_check_last_modified.description: Date the Charity Check report was last modified.

pub78_church_message.description: A message indicating that although the organization is not on the Pub78, their filing requirement code shows that they are a religious organization and are therefore not required to appear on the Pub78 to establish their status.
pub78_church_message.example: This organization is a church or religious organization. Churches and religious organizations qualify for exemption from federal income tax under IRC Section 501(c)(3) and are generally eligible to receive tax-deductible contributions.

pub78_organization_name.description: Organization name as it appears in the Publication 78 data.

pub78_ein.description: EIN (Employer Identification Number) as it appears in the Publication 78 data.

pub78_verified.description: Whether the organization is listed on the most current Publication 78. Also known as the Cumulative List of Organizations, IRS Publication 78 lists all organizations to which charitable contributions are tax deductible. The Publication 78 record for each organization includes the organization's name, its city, and its current tax-exempt status, including what percentage of contributions to it are tax deductible. Subordinate organizations in group exemptions inherit the Pub78 status of the parent organization.

pub78_city.description: City of the organization as it appears in the Publication 78 data.

pub78_state.description: State of the organization as it appears in the Publication 78 data.

pub78_indicator.description: Indicator for understanding an organizations Publication 78 data. Subordinate organizations in group exemptions inherit the Pub78 status of the parent organization.

organization_type.description: Type of organization and use of contribution as it appears in the Publication 78.

deductibility_limitation.description: In general, an individual who itemizes deductions may deduct contributions to most charitable organizations up to 50% of his or her adjusted gross income computed without regard to net operating loss carrybacks. Individuals generally may deduct charitable contributions to other organizations up to 30% of their adjusted gross income (computed without regard to net operating loss carrybacks). These limitations (and organizational status) are indicated.

most_recent_irb.description: Date of the most recent Internal Revenue Bulletin.

bmf_church_message.description: A message indicating that although the organization is not on the IRS BF, their filing requirement code shows that they are a church or religious organization and are therefore not required to appear on the IRS BMF to establish their status.
bmf_church_message.example: This organization is a church or religious organization. Churches and religious organizations qualify for exemption from federal income tax under IRC Section 501(c)(3) and are generally eligible to receive tax-deductible contributions.

bmf_organization_name.description: Organization name as it appears in the Business Master File.

bmf_ein.description: EIN (Employer Identification Number) as it appears in the Business Master File.

bmf_status.description: If the organization appears in the Business Master File.

most_recent_bmf.description: Date of the most recent IRS Business Master File.

bmf_subsection.description: Subsection code as it appears in Business Master File. This code identifies the type of tax-exempt organization. This is often used to determine if contributions to them are tax deductible.

subsection_description.description: Subsection code description as it relates to the subsection code that appears in Business Master File. This code identifies the type of tax-exempt organization. This is often used to determine if contributions to them are tax deductible.

foundation_code.description: Organizations can select IRS foundation codes to describe their organization type.

foundation_code_description.description: Textual description of the foundation code.
foundation_code_description.example: Organization which receives a substantial part of its support from a governmental unit or the general public

ruling_month.description: This is the month on a ruling or determination letter recognizing the organization's exempt status.

ruling_year.description: This is the year on a ruling or determination letter recognizing the organization's exempt status.

adv_ruling_month.description: This is the month on an advanced ruling recognizing the organizations exempt status. A section 501(c)(3) organization that has received an advance ruling with an expiration date on or after June 9, 2008, is classified as a publicly supported charity during its first five years. Such an organization and its donors may rely on the organization's advance ruling and the organization no longer needs to file Form 8734 with the IRS. Beginning with the organization's sixth year, it must establish that it met the public support test by showing that it is publicly supported on its Form 990, Return of Organization Exempt From Income Tax.On September 9, 2008, the IRS issued temporary Income Tax Regulations, which eliminated the advance ruling process for a section 501(c)(3) organization. Under the new regulations, a new 501(c)(3) organization will be classified as a publicly supported charity, and not a private foundation, if it can show that it reasonably can be expected to be publicly supported when it applies for tax-exempt status.

adv_ruling_year.description: This is the year on an advanced ruling recognizing the organizations exempt status. A section 501(c)(3) organization that has received an advance ruling with an expiration date on or after June 9, 2008, is classified as a publicly supported charity during its first five years. Such an organization and its donors may rely on the organization's advance ruling and the organization no longer needs to file Form 8734 with the IRS. Beginning with the organization's sixth year, it must establish that it met the public support test by showing that it is publicly supported on its Form 990, Return of Organization Exempt From Income Tax. On September 9, 2008, the IRS issued temporary Income Tax Regulations, which eliminated the advance ruling process for a section 501(c)(3) organization. Under the new regulations, a new 501(c)(3) organization will be classified as a publicly supported charity, and not a private foundation, if it can show that it reasonably can be expected to be publicly supported when it applies for tax-exempt status.

group_exemption.description: This is a 4-digit IRS-internal number assigned to parent organizations holding group exemption letters. Subordinate organizations in group exemptions inherit the Pub78 status of the parent organization.

exempt_status_code.description: The EO Status Code defines the type of exemption held by the organization.

ofac_status.description: Indicates whether this organization has been listed by OFAC on the Specially Designated National (SDN) List. Also known as the Terrorist Watch List.
ofac_status.example: This organization was not included in the Office of Foreign Assets Control Specially Designated Nationals(SDN) list.

revocation_code.description: Indicates the revocation code provided by the IRS in the Automatic Revocation file.

irs_bmf_pub78_conflict.description: Indicates whether the Business Master File and Publication 78 data are reporting the organization differently regarding its classification as a private foundation.

foundation_509a_status.example: Section 509(a)(1) organization as referred to in Section 170(b)(1)(A)(vi)

irb_organization_id.description: Candid Internal Use Only (Removed in Future API Versions).

bulletin_number.description: If the organization was listed in an Internal Revenue Bulletin, the bulletin number is listed here.

irb_last_modified.description: The date that GuideStar IRB last modification date.

report_date.description: Date and time the Charity Check API returned the result. Reported in Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

foundation_type_code.description: Organizations can select IRS foundation codes to describe their organization type.

foundation_type_description.description: Textual description of the foundation code.
foundation_type_description.example: Public charity described in section 509(a)(1) or (2)

group_exemption.description: This is a four-digit internal number assigned to parent organizations holding group exemption letters.

ProfileDataChangeDates.description: Contains the last change datetimes for several key data values

primary_address_last_modified.description: Datetime of last update to primary address

payment_address_last_modified.description: Datetime of last update to payment address

primary_contact_email_last_modified.description: Datetime of last update to primary contact email address

fundraising_contact_email_last_modified.description: Datetime of last update to fundraising contact email address

org_website_last_modified.description: Datetime of last update to organization website address

seal_last_modified.description: Datetime of last update to organization seal level

dei_last_modified.description: Datetime of last update to organization demographics information

Address.description: Address entry in summary.addresses. Usually an office of an organization.

letter_of_determination_doc_name.description: Document name of the letter of determination

letter_of_determination_url.description: URL to the letter of determination

name.description: Document name of the letter of dissolution

nteeCode.description: National taxonomy of exempt Entities (NTEE) code information

NAICSCode.description: North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) information

PlatinumEvaluationDocument.description: External evaluations support your organization's progress or results

OtherDocument.description: A document the organization uploaded to GuideStar

video_caption.example: GuideStar: Better Data, for Better Decisions, for a Better World

FBResponseText.description: Specific feedback response questions answered by organization

question_text.example: How is your organization collecting feedback from the people you serve?

response_text.example: We regularly collect feedback through: Electronic surveys (by email, tablet, etc.), Focus groups or interviews (by phone or in person), Community meetings/Town halls, Constituent (client or resident, etc.) advisory committees, other: Online Chat

PCS.description: The Philanthropy Classification System (PCS) is Candids (formerly Foundation Center and GuideStar) taxonomy, describing the work of grantmakers, recipient organizations and the philanthropic transactions between those entities. Candids Classification System is based on the National Taxonomy of Exempt Entities (NTEE) and has been expanded over the last three decades to include the emerging work we have evidenced while capturing and indexing the work of the sector on a global scale.

Program3.description: Information about an organization's program as entered by the organization

description.example:
Through data, research, and our collective experience, Candid provides our users with the knowledge they need to make strategic decisions and develop practical solutions to achieve their missions. 

Our GuideStar searchable database currently includes data on 1.9 million 501c3 entities, making it easier to understand who they are and what they do. We support ongoing learning and research by gathering, indexing, and sharing the sectors collective knowledge on IssueLab while also producing our own research that shares insights on issues affecting the social sector. We provide data and knowledge to the philanthropic field by creating new issue-based web portals known as Foundation Landscapes on the topics that matter most to the sector. Through Glasspockets we provide the data, resources, examples, and action steps foundations need to understand the value of transparency, be more open in their own communications, and help shed more light on how private organizations are serving the public good. Candid works closely with organizations around the globe to assist them in collecting and organizing their regions philanthropy data by sharing what we have learned over the past 60 years about data acquisition and data architecture. 

Candids CF Insights program is the leader in data collection and research for the community foundation field in the U.S. with a reputation for benchmarking and analysis of trends. Through CF Insights, we continue to deliver a high level of service to our members and worked with partners to release groundbreaking research on the need for increased collaboration amongst leaders of community foundations.

We also have a number of blogs across our platforms (including the GuideStar blog, GrantSpace blog, GrantCraft blog, GlassPockets blog, Philanthropy News Digest Blog, and more!) that shine a light on relevant topics and trends affecting the sector.

target_population.description: First target population that the program is targeting

target_population2.description: Second target population that the program is targeting

items.description: Name of the geographic area served by the program

PlatinumMetrics1.description: Program metrics entered by the organization

metric.example: Number of organizations you can find on GuideStar

years.description: The years this metric was captured and the values for a given year

target_population_served.description: The target populations that the metric supports

PlatinumMetrics.description: Program metrics entered by the organization

metric.example: Number of organizations you can find on GuideStar

years.description: The years this metric was captured and the values for a given year

target_population_served.description: The target populations that the metric supports

type_of_metric.description: How this metric is being measured
type_of_metric.example: Output - describing our activities and reach

direction_of_success.description: How to determine if this metric is showing a successful trend

Question.description: General question and answer pair, used in multiple places

question.example: How would you summarize the problem or need your organization is working to address?

CurrentFinancial1.description: Current, or most recent, fiscal year (FY) financial information. Since this could come from multiple 990 form types, many of the fields are normalized.

form_type.description: The IRS 990 form type the data in this CurrentFinancial object is based off of.

total_liabilities.description: Total monetary value of liabilities, in USD

revenue_contributions.description: Contributions revenue, i.e. donations, in USD

expense_gifts_grants_paid.description: Gifts and grants paid expenses, in USD

net_gain_loss.description: Net gain/loos this FY, in USD

investments_us_government.description: U.S. bond investment gain/loss, in USD

land_buildings_equipment.description: Land, buildings, equipment end of year value, in USD

other_assets.description: Other assets end of year value, in USD

CurrentFinancial.description: Current, or most recent, fiscal year (FY) financial information. Since this could come from multiple 990 form types, many of the fields are normalized.

period_end.description: End date of the fiscal year that this current financial object covers

form_type.description: The IRS 990 form type the data in this CurrentFinancial object is based off of.

total_liabilities.description: Total monetary value of liabilities, in USD

revenue_contributions.description: Contributions revenue, i.e. donations, in USD

net_fixed_assets_LBE.description: Land, buildings and equipment fixed assets, in USD

notes_payable_mortgages.description: mortgages and notes payable to unrelated 3rd parties, in USD

months_of_cash.description: A measurement of how long an organization can operate using cash and cash reserves at current expense levels. Calculated using the formula - Cash plus Savings divided by Total Expenses minus Depreciation divided by 12 months.

expense_gifts_grants_paid.description: Gifts and grants paid expenses, in USD

investments_us_government.description: U.S. bond investment gain/loss, in USD

land_buildings_equipment.description: Land, buildings, equipment end of year value, in USD

other_assets.description: Other assets end of year value, in USD

revenue_sales.description: Revenue from sales of tangible items

months_of_cash.description: A measurement of how long an organization can operate using cash and cash reserves at current expense levels. Calculated using the formula - Cash plus Savings divided by Total Expenses minus Depreciation divided by 12 months.

year.description: The year the document is from.

months_of_cash.description: A measurement of how long an organization can operate using cash and cash reserves at current expense levels. Calculated using the formula: Cash plus Savings divided by Total Expenses minus Depreciation divided by 12 months.

liquidity.description: The ratio of an organization's capacity to repay its current liabilities through cash and cash equivalents. Metric calculated using the 'Quick Ratio' (Cash + Savings + Short Term Investments + Accounts Receivable) / Total Liabilities.

fringe_rate.description: The cost of employee benefits divided by the wages paid to employees. Calculated using the formula: Pensions plus Benefits plus Payroll Tax Totals divided by Current Compensation plus Total Wages.

net_gain_loss.description: The amount of net gain or net loss.
